main.node

Class InternalNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.node.InternalNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Node

    public class InternalNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements Node
    This class represents a node that belongs to the Chord ring. It provides all the methods that deal with the the ring structure and file management.
    Author:
    Alfonso Marco, Martini Davide Distributed Systems class (AY 2017/2018), University of Padua, Master's degree in Computer Engineering.

    • Constructor Summary

      • closestPrecedingNode

        public java.net.InetSocketAddress closestPrecedingNode(java.math.BigInteger id)
        This method is called to compute the closest preceding node of a given id. It is based on the information provided by the finger table of the current node
        Parameters:
        id - The id of an internal node
        Returns:
        The address of the closest preceding node

      • insertFile

        public boolean insertFile(java.net.Socket s,
                          java.lang.String fileName)
        This method is called to download and insert a file into the pool of files whose responsibility relies on the invoker
        Parameters:
        s - It is the socket where to download the file
        fileName - The name of the file to be inserted
        Returns:
        True if the whole operation is performed correctly

      • hasFile

        public boolean hasFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method is called to verify if a given file is available from the pool
        Parameters:
        fileName - The desired file name
        Returns:
        True if the current node is responsible for it (thus it stores the file), false otherwise

      • getFilesInterval

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFilesInterval(java.math.BigInteger from,
                                                              java.math.BigInteger to)
        This method is called to get a list of files (present in the invoker's pool) whose name belongs to a specific interval
        Parameters:
        from - The beginning of the interval
        to - The end of the interval
        Returns:
        The list of all the file names that belong to the interval

      • deleteFilesInterval

        public boolean deleteFilesInterval(java.math.BigInteger from,
                                   java.math.BigInteger to)
        This method is called to delete all the files whose names belong to the specified interval. The files are both removed from the pool and physically
        Parameters:
        from - The beginning of the interval
        to - The end of the interval
        Returns:
        True if the operation is performed correctly

      • singleInsert

        public boolean singleInsert(java.net.Socket s,
                            java.lang.String fileName)
        This method is called to download a file. The difference between this and insertFile() method is that here no file replica is passed to the predecessor
        Specified by:
        singleInsert in interface Node
        Parameters:
        s - It is the socket where to download the file
        fileName - The name of the file to be downloaded
        Returns:
        True if the operation is performed correctly

      • singleDelete

        public boolean singleDelete(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method is called to delete a file. The difference between this and deleteFile() method is that here the predecessor is not notified to remove its file replica
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to be deleted
        Returns:
        True if the operation is performed correctly

      • getLocalId

        public java.math.BigInteger getLocalId()
        This method is called to get the invoker's id
        Returns:
        The id of the internal node

        This method is called to get the invoker's address

      • isJoinAvailable

        public boolean isJoinAvailable()
        This method is called to check if the invoker can sustain a join operation
        Returns:
        True if the node can sustain a join operation, false otherwise

      • getAndSetJoinAvailable

        public boolean getAndSetJoinAvailable(boolean value)
        This method is called to get and set the value of the joinAvailable variable
        Parameters:
        value - It is the new joinAvailable value
        Returns:
        The joinAvailable value before the setting

      • setPredecessor

        public boolean setPredecessor(java.net.InetSocketAddress newPred)
        This method is called to set a new predecessor to the current node. When the predecessor is changed, the FileUpdater may start to stabilize the file location in the ring
        Parameters:
        newPred - The address of the new predecessor
        Returns:
        True if the operation is performed correctly

      • setSuccessor

        public boolean setSuccessor(java.net.InetSocketAddress newSucc)
        This method is called to set a new successor to the current node. When the successor is changed, the FileUpdater may start to stabilize the file location in the ring
        Parameters:
        newSucc - The address of the new successor
        Returns:
        True if the operation is performed correctly

        public java.net.InetSocketAddress getPredAddress()

        Returns:
        The predecessor's address

        public java.net.InetSocketAddress getSuccAddress()
        This method is called to get the address of the invoker's successor
        Returns:
        The successor's address

      • getfTable

        public FingerTable getfTable()
        This method is called to get the invoker's finger table
        Returns:
        The finger table of the internal node

      • getFiles

        public java.lang.String getFiles()
